result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated October 16, 2022 -  Defendant's concerns about his attorney and the district attorney.

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on October 20, 2022 - Concerns can be addressed at the next hearing on 11/11/22.**

1:48 PM Defendant Thomas A Walker III in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Thomas A Walker III.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense request a status in November to speak to the charging DA.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Thomas A Walker III in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Thomas A Walker III. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. There are no victims in this case. 

Court addresses amended information filed by the State adding counts 7 & 8.
Defense is still receiving discovery and needs more time for further investigation. 
Amended information pulled through.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Angela Wang by Attorney Anna Kees, in court, defendant Thomas A Walker not in court, in custody (defendant refused to come out to court).
Defense waives her client's appearance.
Court to Address:  Defendant's Request for Bail Modification (Reduction of Cash Bail or Huber Bailee Status).

State objects to any modification of bond - Arguments presented.
Defense presented bail arguments.
Court Denies - Defense Motion For Bail Reduction.
Reasons placed on the record.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form from defendant regarding a bail reduction at his upcoming hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on July 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Wang.
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:35 AM Defendant Thomas A Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:40 PM Defendant Thomas A Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Andy Herbers for attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail remains as fixed.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
